name: aloft Lexington

reviews.title: Good enough for a decent price
reviews.text: I really like the vibe of these more modern hotels that seem to cater to youngish' guests. We had never stayed at an Aloft but one just opened near where we live and so this struck my curiosity. In searching for a property near Boston we thought that trying out this brand would be a good idea.

Overall the place met our expectations. The hotel is very cool from the moment you enter and the rooms are furnished/designed in a modern/fun style. The beds were comfortable and everything seemed clean enough. It is not a luxury place but stylistically it does remind me of the W Hotels I have stayed in.

The only real complaint would be about the faucet in the bathroom. New hotels are certainly making more of an effort these days to be more green and that is really great. I can only guess that this effort to be more green (by saving water) is what the issue was with the sink faucet in our room. Basically the water came out in a similar fashion as it does at some airports/restaurants....in a delicate, spray/shower like way that made rinsing soap off difficult. The water saving aspects are lost when guests are forced to wait around to collect enough water for a really long time to wash the suds off their hands or to wet their face. The faucet issue is not a terrible thing everything considered but a bit annoying.
reviews.title: Perfectly good hotel if the location is what you are looking for...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you are in the area and want an affordable, comfortable place to stay this Aloft in Lexington fits the bill. It is a budget place but without many of the issues that budget hotels tend to have.
reviews.title: Minimalist decor - budget-type hotel

reviews.text: Ok this hotel is unique. It is very club style hotel, seems upbeat and fun. Rooms are very nice and clean. You can tell they really keep their rooms up to date. They have a box in your room that is set up to connect any device you have computer etc, to the tv that's in the room. The pool and spa is fantastic cant complain. The staff is fantastic, everyone is friendly and when it comes to service it is quick. the internet is included and free.
reviews.title: attention to style less on function

reviews.text: This is not your average business traveler hotel. They clearly are trying to create a "different" experience, and I personally enjoyed it. Very modern, hip, and clearly geared toward a younger crowd. I stayed for two nights while visiting my company's Waltham office. It's a little tricky to find, as it is tucked behind a mountain, but it is very conveniently located near the highway. The lobby area is a large, open space, with a bar/lounge, and a food/snack area in the corner. It's a very social environment, with semi-loud pop music playing throughout the main areas and elevators. The front desk is more like a retail checkout counter, right in the middle of the room. While I arrived late the first night (after the bar had closed), on the second evening the lounge was very popular, with probably 20+ people in the bar, pool table, and lounge areas. The food/snack area was well stocked with grab and go items, and offered a pretty decent cooked to order breakfast menu (not free though). There is no traditional restaurant. The modern styled room wasn't all that large, but offered a nice comfortable platform bed, a desk looking out the window with a cool device to hook your electronics into the large flat screen TV, and a unique closet / divider between the main room and bathroom. The large windows were great for natural light / views, but also had good blackout shades for sleeping. They included a free bottle of water each day, and there is a small fridge, but no microwave. My only complaints were no iron & ironing board in the room (had to request from the front desk), and the doors to the rooms don't have adequate dampers, so they "slam" loudly when guests let them close by themselves at all hours of the day and night. Overall, I appreciated the unique experience, and will gladly return to stay on my next business trip to the area.
reviews.title: Fun, hip, modern take on the typical hotel experience

reviews.text: This hotel had a great vibe to it. The lobby area was modern and more than just your typical hotel lobby. The space was large and open and included a lounge area with couches and fireplace, a bar area, a sitting/eating area with small tables, a pool table, computers and ipads for use, and even some board games in the lounge! There was also a small area where food was available. There hotel also had an indoor pool, and although my husband and I did not visit, my nieces and nephews had a good time.
reviews.title: Modern, chic hotel in Lexington

reviews.text: The staff was really friendly and never seemed bothered by any requests. The breakfast sandwiches provided in the lobby are pretty tasty. The staff didn't even get upset when we came downstairs to order 8 breakfast sandwiches about 5 minutes before they were to stop serving breakfast. The cook was insistent on making us another sandwich and then gave us the original mishap free of charge when we realized that the order had been put in the computer wrong.
reviews.title: No sleep from loud music
A business hotel designed for me...
reviews.text: The rooms were quite nice, and pretty modern and stylish. The rooms had two really large windows which were great for natural lighting, but also had very dark shades in order to keep morning light out. Everything was clean and tidy feeling. There was also a small fridge in the room, no microwave though.

The one downside to this hotel was it's thin walls and really heavy doors. We could hear everything in the hallways, even people just speaking in normal voices. On top of that, every time someone left their room and didn't shut the door, but let it shut itself, we heard it slam, and it was fairly loud at late hours of the night and early hours of the morning.
reviews.title: Great Value

reviews.text: I like what this hotel is trying to be about. It has a modern look and feel. I booked on Priceline. I had 2 reservations on priceline, one for one night and the other for two nights. Was told I had to check out after the first night and resubmit my credit card but not change rooms. Not a big deal, but why do I need to do this?
reviews.title: Toilet paper please

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: More importantly:
reviews.title: Great place to stay.

reviews.text: -Toilet paper would be nice... how does housekeeping miss that?
reviews.title: Good & not so good

reviews.text: - Mattress lumpy
reviews.title: Great price, modern and clean

reviews.text: - Hallway water damage
reviews.title: What a wonderful place.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I typically stay at more traditional hotels. However, I got a good rate at aLOFT and decided to try it during the Patriot's Day Weekend in Boston.
reviews.title: Interesting

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Before I arrived, I received a notice on my phone that said "you are checked into room 426. Please stop by the front desk to get a key when you enter the hotel." It was very high tech!
reviews.title: Pretty good, but know what you're getting

reviews.text: The rooms were very clean and utilitarian. The staff was informal, yet responsive. They have a nice bar in the lobby and a place to buy snacks. It is in a good central location just off i95 10 miles outside of Boston. Parking is free and the beds were comfortable.
reviews.title: Great getaway in Boston

reviews.text: I'll try it again!
reviews.title: Great value

reviews.text: Pluses: Friendly staff. Excellent sleep quality -- good bed, great curtains, a little quieter than most. Wifi works better than most hotels. Free bottle of water daily. $5 discount at breakfast if you skip maid service. Gym and pool looked fine. Dog-friendly.
reviews.title: Better off across the parking lot at Element

description: Aloft Lexington offers a modern and bold travel experience in a historic Boston suburb, surrounded by revolutionary battlegrounds & quaint New England towns and just 20 min from downtown Boston.
